Package com.github.tommyettinger.gand.algorithms

Class SearchStep<V>

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.gand.algorithms.SearchStep<V>
Type Parameters:
V -
public class SearchStep<V> extends Object
An object representing a "step" in a search algorithm. Usually this corresponds to visiting or processing a vertex.

  • Method Details

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Immediately terminate the search.

    • ignore

      public void ignore()
      Ignore the current vertex, and do not check its neighbours in this step.

    • vertex

      public V vertex()
      Returns:
      the vertex being currently processed.

    • edge

      public Edge<V> edge()
      Returns:
      the edge from which the current vertex was found. Edge.getB() is equal to the current vertex.

    • previous

      public V previous()
      Returns:
      the vertex from which the current vertex was found. Equal to Edge.getA() on the edge returned by edge().

    • depth

      public int depth()
      Returns:
      the number of vertices traversed in order to find the current vertex, not including the initial vertex.

    • distance

      public float distance()
      Returns:
      the sum of edge weights on a path from the initial vertex to the current, along the search path taken. For a shortest path search this represents the actual minimum distance of all shortest paths from the initial vertex to the current, for a breadth or depth first search this is not necessarily true.

    • count

      public int count()
      Returns:
      the number of processing steps so far.

    • createPath

      public Path<V> createPath()
      Reconstruct the path from the initial vertex to the current vertex that the search algorithm took. For a shortest path search this is an actual shortest path from the initial vertex to the current in the graph, for a breadth or depth first search this is not necessarily true.
      Returns:
      a path from the initial vertex to the current
